Title: Data Scientist, EDP Research
JD:
About the job
    


Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

As a Data Scientist on the Economic Development Policy Research team (EDPR), the candidate will transform ambiguous situations into clearly defined problems, help leaders ask the right questions, and deliver data-driven solutions suitable for a wide variety of customers. The candidate will work with global teams and data that touches every Amazon business. This role combines business understanding, science leadership, organizational power, technical strength, and product focus.

The candidate must have experience using advanced quantitative techniques for answering specific business questions, and an expert at synthesizing and communicating insights and recommendations to customers of varying levels of technical sophistication. The candidate will probe assumptions, illuminate blind spots, and foster shared understanding. The candidate must have superior verbal and written communication skills and a demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment.

Key job responsibilities
 Engage with diverse end user groups, business leaders, and technical partners to gather requirements and translate ambiguous business questions into specific quantitative questions that can be answered with available data using sound methodologies. Develop analytic plans for data modeling processes. Design and build new, scalable data science models to address diverse business needs, using methods from statistics and economics. Leverage statistical analysis and modeling algorithms to dive deep into business questions using SQL and scripting languages like Python/R. Retrieve, synthesize, and present critical data from imperfect data sources. Produce meaningful and easily digestible insights for senior leaders. Conduct written and verbal presentations to share insights and recommendations to customers of varying levels of technical sophistication. Reinforce an environment of self-service with stakeholders for repeat requests through continuous development of knowledge bank, report library, or other mechanisms. Apply domain knowledge and business judgment to identify and execute on high impact projects and quantify the impact that informs research direction and prioritization of projects. Collaborate with PMs to look around corners and build actionable product roadmaps, ensuring the work meets the needs of stakeholders in time for the results to be useful. Provide thought leadership on data, design, and methods to help define a long-term science vision for the team. Develop domain expertise and drive major contributions to the EDPR analytics and research roadmap. Partner with Data Engineering and Software Development Teams to define requirements for data elements and structures. Participate in cross-functional projects that contribute to the long-term vision and success of the organization’s data infrastructure.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree3+ years of experience with data scripting languages (e.g SQL, Python, R etc.) or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, or Matlab)2 years working as a Data Scientist Master’s degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, or related quantitative field. 3+ years of work experience as a data scientist or a similar role involving data extraction, analysis, statistical modeling, and communication. 5+ years of experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, Matlab). 3+ years of experience working directly with business stakeholders to translate between data and business needs. 3+ years of experience articulating business questions and using quantitative techniques to arrive at solutions using available data. 3+ years of experience using cloud storage and computing technologies such as AWS Redshift, S3. 1+ years of experience communicating rigorous mathematical concepts and considerations to non-experts. Ability and desire to travel.
Preferred Qualifications
 Experience communicating with and presenting to senior leadership. Experience using data to tell stories. Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, QuickSight, or similar. Experience working with economists, software development teams, and other technical roles on large, complex data science projects
Team Culture

Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Mentorship and Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Amazon Robotics
JD:
About the job
    


Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

The Research Team at Amazon Robotics is seeking a passionate, hands-on Senior Data Scientist, with a track record of industrial research, innovation, technology transfer, and leadership.

At Amazon Robotics, we apply cutting edge advances in robotics, software development, and Big Data to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet. We operate hundreds of buildings that employ hundreds of thousands of robots teaming up to perform sophisticated, large-scale missions. There are a lot of exciting opportunities ahead of us that can be unlocked by scientific research. Amazon Robotics has a dedicated focus on research and development to continuously explore new opportunities to extend its product lines into new areas.

As you could imagine, data is at the core of our innovation. This role will be be participating in creating the Data Science and Machine Learning vision, influencing business strategy by discovering endless possibilities with data, and leading the way to industrializing our new initiatives.

Key job responsibilities

This Role Will Be Responsible For
Thinking Big and ideating with the Data Science team and stakeholders.Working with customers and cross-functional stakeholder teams to identify, disambiguate, and define problems.Leading stakeholder teams to prioritize, scope, plan, and lead the execution and transfer of new Data Science/Machine Learning products/features.Supporting the creation of scalable Data Science/Machine Learning architectures.Partnering with Engineering teams to productize Data Science and Machine Leaning architectures, models and algorithms.Creating supporting models for existing solutions, while thinking about next generation solutions.Supporting the hiring, development, and mentoring of new scientists.
A day in the life

By learning the continuously evolving Amazon Robotic Systems and external trends, you will identify business opportunities that can be unlocked with the recent advances in Data Science and Machine Learning. You will lead key stakeholder teams to prioritize new initiatives, which are scientifically diverse, including forecasting, optimization, multi-agent coordination, perception, policy learning, data-driven system modeling, etc. You will lead the creation of new value propositions and business cases. You will own the agile process of scoping, planning and prototyping. You will plan and lead technology transfer to internal Amazon Robotics customers. You will help hire and develop new scientists.

About The Team

You will join a scientifically and demographically diverse research/science team. Our multi-disciplinary team includes scientists with backgrounds in planning/scheduling, grasping/manipulation, machine learning, and operations research. We develop novel algorithms and machine learning methods and apply them to real-word robotic warehouses, including:
Planning/coordinating the paths of thousands of robotsDynamic task allocation to thousands of robotsLearning how to manipulate all products sold by AmazonCo-design an optimization of robotic logistics processesOur team also serves as a hub to foster innovation and support scientists across Amazon Robotics. In addition, we coordinate research engagements with academia


Basic Qualifications
Master’s degree (or Bachelor's degree + 8 years of experience) in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Business Analytics, Economics, Finance, Engineering, or Computer Science5+ years of experience working as a data scientist or a similar role involving data extraction, analysis, statistical modeling, and communication5+ years of experience using data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages e.g. Python, or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, Matlab, etc.)Prior experience with cloud technologies (preferably AWS)Prior technical leadership and/or management experienceComfortable dealing with ambiguity and making headway in the face of uncertaintyProven success as both an independent performer and a contributing member of a high-performing team; showing the ability to dive deep and develop innovative ideas for process challengesExposure to best practices in data analytics and reporting; data integrity, data analysis, data mining, design of experiments, and documentationExperience in working directly with customers (internal or external), disambiguating problems, scoping requirements, and planning/executing on Data Science projects.
Preferred Qualifications
PhD in Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or in highly quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Operations Research, Systems Engineering, Physics)10+ years of industry experience in Engineering, Science and/or Product MangementDomain expertise in warehouse automation, robotics, and/or supply chain optimization.Experience with Apache Spark/HDFS and Deep Learning frameworks, such as Tensorflow, Keras, or MXNet.Experience with Cloud ML technologies, preferably SageMaker.Experience with Agile frameworks, e.g, Scrum.Comfort using a UNIX-like terminal and shell scripts.Prior experience in optimizing multi-robot systems.

About the job
    


Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Locations available for this position are: [USA: New York City, NY; Seattle, WA; Arlington, VA; Bay Area, CA; or Canada: Toronto, ON].

Amazon is investing heavily in building a world class advertising business, operating at the intersection of retail and advertising. Amazon Advertising delivers billions of ad impressions and millions of clicks daily and is breaking fresh ground to create unique advertising experiences for hundreds of thousands of advertisers and shoppers globally. Our team, Physical Stores Advertising, focuses on developing engaging advertising products for customers that shop at physical stores, such as Whole Foods Market, Amazon Fresh, Amazon Style, and Amazon Go, as well as third-party stores not owned by Amazon. We're tackling a relatively new area for Amazon Advertising and building technology from the ground up. This is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor on a high-growth team that values experimentation and innovation. We start with the customer and work backwards in everything we do. If you are interested in joining a rapidly growing team working to build a unique, world-class advertising group with a relentless focus on the customer, you have come to the right place.

Our Team

We own building, launching, and commercializing innovative ad products in-store and do not shy away from technical challenges. Our team is responsible for full-stack implementation and integration of new advertising products, which power the ad content, targeting, and attribution across our advertising network with physical stores. We utilize the latest in cloud technology to build out products supporting custom experiences, both in browser and on mobile platforms, using custom hardware and android operating systems. We are also experimenting in new areas, leveraging computer vision, machine learning, and big data, to provide unique experiences for physical store shoppers and advertisers alike.

What We Are Looking For

We are looking for exceptionally motivated and talented Data Engineers who are self-starters with strong customer obsession to transform advertising in physical stores. The ideal candidate will have excellent problem investigation abilities, and the ability to synthesize data into crisp and clear recommendations for scientists and product leaders. To be successful in this role, you should have broad skills in database design, be comfortable dealing with large and complex data sets, have experience building self-service dashboards, be comfortable using visualization tools, and be able to apply your skills to generate insights that help solve business needs.

What To Expect

Engineers and Scientists who join our team will find the work has a high-growth potential with a large scope and complexity which can be catered to your professional development goals. You will have the opportunity to learn and become an expert in multiple domains technical and functional. We have a tenured leadership team with years of experience in their respective fields and we strive to be Earth’s best employer. For us, this means we care about work life balance, host team events and happy hours, hold hackathons to foster innovation, prioritize building a diverse culture, care about individual success, and never take ourselves too seriously.

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Device Ad Products is a business initiative focused on monetizing Amazon owned and operated devices. To do this, we are continuously expanding and improving a premium advertising platform that is uniquely positioned to drive growth in two of Amazon's fastest growing businesses: Advertising and Devices. Our group functions as a start-up within Amazon, and offers a creative, fast paced, entrepreneurial work environment where you’ll be at the center of Amazon innovation.

We are looking for a Software Development Engineer to join our Device Ad Platform. This is a great opportunity for a results-oriented, entrepreneurial individual who enjoys working on large scale, high performance, data processing and real-time optimization problems. You will be a part of an exceptional engineering team that owns the systems processing hundreds of millions ad events on a daily basis. You will have ample opportunity to learn and utilize different programming languages, design patterns, AWS services, and open source frameworks to solve interesting engineering problems. Your work will directly contribute to generating ad performance metrics that meet our latency requirements and high data quality bar ensuring that our business provides timely and accurate reporting to Device Ads advertisers.

You will need to think creatively and strategically about our business, and work together with other engineers, technical program managers, and product managers to identify and execute on the most promising opportunities. You will be responsible for defining high-level architecture, for writing world-class software, and for helping us to continually adjust and improve our software development practices and processes. Your success will be measured by your ability to build feature sets that deliver a strong user experience for Fire Tablet users as well as attract and retain advertisers while generating positive feedback from all our customers.

Join us today, and become a leader of this highly motivated, cooperative and fun-loving team!

The candidate will work with global teams and data that touches every Amazon business. This role combines business understanding, science leadership, organizational power, technical strength, and product focus.

The candidate must have experience using advanced quantitative techniques for answering specific business questions, and an expert at synthesizing and communicating insights and recommendations to customers of varying levels of technical sophistication. The candidate will probe assumptions, illuminate blind spots, and foster shared understanding. The candidate must have superior verbal and written communication skills and a demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment.

Key job responsibilities
 Engage with diverse end user groups, business leaders, and technical partners to gather requirements and translate ambiguous business questions into specific quantitative questions that can be answered with available data using sound methodologies. Develop analytic plans for data modeling processes. Design and build new, scalable data science models to address diverse business needs, using methods from statistics and economics. Leverage statistical analysis and modeling algorithms to dive deep into business questions using SQL and scripting languages like Python/R. Retrieve, synthesize, and present critical data from imperfect data sources. Produce meaningful and easily digestible insights for senior leaders. Conduct written and verbal presentations to share insights and recommendations to customers of varying levels of technical sophistication. Reinforce an environment of self-service with stakeholders for repeat requests through continuous development of knowledge bank, report library, or other mechanisms. Apply domain knowledge and business judgment to identify and execute on high impact projects and quantify the impact that informs research direction and prioritization of projects. Collaborate with PMs to look around corners and build actionable product roadmaps, ensuring the work meets the needs of stakeholders in time for the results to be useful. Provide thought leadership on data, design, and methods to help define a long-term science vision for the team. Develop domain expertise and drive major contributions to the EDPR analytics and research roadmap. Partner with Data Engineering and Software Development Teams to define requirements for data elements and structures. Participate in cross-functional projects that contribute to the long-term vision and success of the organization’s data infrastructure.

Basic Qualifications
 Master’s degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, or related quantitative field. 5+ years of work experience as a data scientist or a similar role involving data extraction, analysis, statistical modeling, and communication. 5+ years of experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, Matlab). 3+ years of experience working directly with business stakeholders to translate between data and business needs. 3+ years of experience articulating business questions and using quantitative techniques to arrive at solutions using available data. 3+ years of experience using cloud storage and computing technologies such as AWS Redshift, S3. 1+ years of experience communicating rigorous mathematical concepts and considerations to non-experts. Ability and desire to travel.
Preferred Qualifications
 Experience communicating with and presenting to senior leadership. Experience using data to tell stories. Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, QuickSight, or similar. Experience working with economists, software development teams, and other technical roles on large, complex data science projects

Title: Senior Data Scientist, EDP Research
JD:
About the job
    


Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

As a Data Scientist on the Economic Development Policy Research team (EDPR), the candidate will transform ambiguous situations into clearly defined problems, help leaders ask the right questions, and deliver data-driven solutions suitable for a wide variety of customers. The candidate will work with global teams and data that touches every Amazon business. This role combines business understanding, science leadership, organizational power, technical strength, and product focus.

The candidate must have experience using advanced quantitative techniques for answering specific business questions, and an expert at synthesizing and communicating insights and recommendations to customers of varying levels of technical sophistication. The candidate will probe assumptions, illuminate blind spots, and foster shared understanding. The candidate must have superior verbal and written communication skills and a demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment.

Key job responsibilities
 Engage with diverse end user groups, business leaders, and technical partners to gather requirements and translate ambiguous business questions into specific quantitative questions that can be answered with available data using sound methodologies. Develop analytic plans for data modeling processes. Design and build new, scalable data science models to address diverse business needs, using methods from statistics and economics. Leverage statistical analysis and modeling algorithms to dive deep into business questions using SQL and scripting languages like Python/R. Retrieve, synthesize, and present critical data from imperfect data sources. Produce meaningful and easily digestible insights for senior leaders. Conduct written and verbal presentations to share insights and recommendations to customers of varying levels of technical sophistication. Reinforce an environment of self-service with stakeholders for repeat requests through continuous development of knowledge bank, report library, or other mechanisms. Apply domain knowledge and business judgment to identify and execute on high impact projects and quantify the impact that informs research direction and prioritization of projects. Collaborate with PMs to look around corners and build actionable product roadmaps, ensuring the work meets the needs of stakeholders in time for the results to be useful. Provide thought leadership on data, design, and methods to help define a long-term science vision for the team. Develop domain expertise and drive major contributions to the EDPR analytics and research roadmap. Partner with Data Engineering and Software Development Teams to define requirements for data elements and structures. Participate in cross-functional projects that contribute to the long-term vision and success of the organization’s data infrastructure.

Basic Qualifications
 Master’s degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, or related quantitative field. 5+ years of work experience as a data scientist or a similar role involving data extraction, analysis, statistical modeling, and communication. 5+ years of experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, Matlab). 3+ years of experience working directly with business stakeholders to translate between data and business needs. 3+ years of experience articulating business questions and using quantitative techniques to arrive at solutions using available data. 3+ years of experience using cloud storage and computing technologies such as AWS Redshift, S3. 1+ years of experience communicating rigorous mathematical concepts and considerations to non-experts. Ability and desire to travel.
Preferred Qualifications
 Experience communicating with and presenting to senior leadership. Experience using data to tell stories. Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, QuickSight, or similar. Experience working with economists, software development teams, and other technical roles on large, complex data science projects
